tree.original_reasoning:
Okay, I need to figure out what code to fill in for the reversed string part. The task is to reverse "Hello World" using Apache Commons Lang. Let me think... The StringUtils class has various methods. Oh right, there's a reverse() method in StringUtils. So instead of manually reversing the string, I can just call StringUtils.reverse("Hello World"). 

Wait, let me make sure. The import is already there for StringUtils, so that should work. The line is assigned to 'reversed', so the TODO should be replaced with that method call. So the line would be:

String reversed = StringUtils.reverse("Hello World");

I think that's all. Let me double-check the method name. Yes, Apache Commons Lang's StringUtils does have a reverse() function. So that's the correct code to put there.
